theme.name: Biblical Journey
theme.description: Journey through biblical locations to Jerusalem

positive.title: Angel of the Sacrifice
positive.effect: When you would lose SP from any source, this card prevents all loss. Discard after use.

positive.title: Hagar's Comforter
positive.effect: Gain 2 SP and recover 1 livestock. The angel provides water in the wilderness.

positive.title: Lot's Deliverers
positive.effect: Move immediately to any location on the board. Angels lead you to safety before judgment falls.

positive.title: Jacob's Ladder
positive.effect: Gain 4 SP. The connection between heaven and earth brings great blessing.

positive.title: Burning Bush Angel
positive.effect: Gain 1 Helper immediately from any character, regardless of your points with them. Divine calling transcends normal requirements.

positive.title: Balaam's Rebuke
positive.effect: Look at the next character you will encounter. Choose whether to proceed or move to a different location.

positive.title: Captain of the Host
positive.effect: Your next encounter with wolves or bandits is automatically won without rolling. Divine authority commands victory.

positive.title: Gideon's Fire
positive.effect: For your next 3 turns, gain +1 SP for every correct answer (4 total instead of 3).

positive.title: Samson's Announcer
positive.effect: Choose a character you have 0-1 points with. Gain 2 points with them immediately. Great purposes require divine announcement.

positive.title: Elijah's Provider
positive.effect: Gain 3 SP and recover all lost livestock and coins. God's provision sustains His prophets.

positive.title: Elisha's Army
positive.effect: Immunity to all Demon card effects for the next 4 turns. The mountain is full of horses and chariots of fire.

positive.title: Assyrian Destroyer
positive.effect: All other players lose 2 SP. The angel of the LORD protects His people while judging enemies.

positive.title: Daniel's Guardian
positive.effect: Wolves cannot attack you for the rest of the game. Your faithfulness shuts the lions' mouths.

positive.title: Fourth in the Fire
positive.effect: When you would lose SP or offerings, roll a die. On 4-6, you lose nothing. Keep this card permanently.

positive.title: Gabriel's Revelation
positive.effect: Look at any other player's SP total, livestock, coins, and helpers. Gain 2 SP from divine insight.

positive.title: Michael's Protection
positive.effect: Choose another player. They cannot affect you negatively for 3 turns. The prince of Israel defends his people.

positive.title: Prison Breaker
positive.effect: If you land on a space that would cause you to lose a turn or miss moves, ignore the effect. Discard after use.

positive.title: Philip's Guide
positive.effect: On your next turn, move to any location instead of rolling. Divine guidance leads to great opportunities.

positive.title: Birth Announcement
positive.effect: All players gain 2 SP. The greatest news brings joy to all people.

demonCards.title: Ancient Serpent
demonCards.effect: You surely do not need those offerings. Lose half your livestock and half your coins (rounded down). The first lie still deceives.

demonCards.title: Spirit of Murder
demonCards.effect: Choose another player. They lose 3 SP and you steal 1 SP from them. Sin desires to master and destroy.

demonCards.title: Evil Spirit of Saul
demonCards.effect: For your next 3 turns, roll a die before answering questions. On 1-3, you cannot use Helper hints or earn Helper points.

demonCards.title: Satan's Test of Job
demonCards.effect: Lose 2 livestock, 2 coins, and 1 Helper of your choice. Sometimes the righteous suffer to prove their faith.

demonCards.title: Temptation of Appetite
demonCards.effect: Turn these stones to bread. Pay 4 SP immediately or lose your next turn. Physical needs distract from spiritual purpose.

demonCards.title: Temptation of Pride
demonCards.effect: Cast yourself down! Choose: either lose 4 SP or take double damage from your next wolf/bandit encounter.

demonCards.title: Temptation of Power
demonCards.effect: All these kingdoms will I give you. Gain 8 SP, but lose all your Helpers. Worldly success costs spiritual relationships.

demonCards.title: Legion of Torment
demonCards.effect: My name is Legion, for we are many. Roll two dice and lose that many SP. Spiritual oppression multiplies suffering.

demonCards.title: Mute Spirit
demonCards.effect: You cannot use any Helper hints for your next 3 turns. The spirit of silence prevents testimony and wisdom.

demonCards.title: Blinding Spirit
demonCards.effect: For your next 2 questions, you cannot see what location you're on when answering. Spiritual blindness hides truth.

demonCards.title: False Prophet Spirit
demonCards.effect: Gain insight into coming doom. All other players lose 2 SP. False prophecy brings confusion and fear.

demonCards.title: Convulsing Spirit
demonCards.effect: Skip your next turn and lose 2 livestock. This kind requires prayer and fasting to overcome.

demonCards.title: Spirit of Eighteen Years
demonCards.effect: For the next 3 turns, you can only earn half SP from correct answers (rounded down). Satan's bonds limit progress.

demonCards.title: Unclean Spirit
demonCards.effect: Let us alone! You cannot gain Helper points with any character for your next 2 turns. Demons resist holy fellowship.

demonCards.title: Spirit of Greed
demonCards.effect: All players must pay you 1 coin or lose 3 SP. Your choice which they do. False profits exploit God's people.

demonCards.title: Deceiving Spirit
demonCards.effect: Jesus I know, Paul I know, but who are you? Lose all points with one Helper of your choice. False authority brings shame.

demonCards.title: Messenger of Satan
demonCards.effect: Keep this card. At the start of each turn, lose 1 SP, but gain +1 to trivia rolls. Weakness can teach dependence on grace.

demonCards.title: The Great Dragon
demonCards.effect: All players lose their most valuable resource (count SP value: livestock + coins). The deceiver wages war against all saints.

demonCards.title: Beast of Persecution
demonCards.effect: Choose a player. They cannot earn SP for 2 turns and you steal 1 of their Helpers. Power wars against the saints.

demonCards.title: Lake of Fire
demonCards.effect: All players must sacrifice 5 SP or lose all their livestock. The final judgment demands everything.

sections.title: 🎯 Objective
sections.content: You're an Israelite journeying to Jerusalem to make your annual sacrifice. After disaster strikes your prepared offerings, you must earn new sacrificial offerings along the way. First player to reach 40 Sacrifice Points wins! Refresh the page to start a new game.

sections.title: 🎲 Basic Gameplay
sections.content: Players start at 'Your Village' with 0 Sacrifice Points (SP). Roll the die to move around the board clockwise. Answer trivia questions at biblical locations to earn SP. Redeem SP for livestock and coins as offerings. Pass 'Your Village' to gain 5 SP.

sections.title: 📚 Trivia Questions
sections.content: Correct Answer: 3 SP | With Helper Hint: 2 SP  | Don't Know: 1 SP | Each question can only be answered once per game. Answered questions become greyed out.

sections.title: 👥 Helpers
sections.content: Answer 3 questions from the same biblical character to recruit them as a Helper. Helpers provide hints for questions at their locations. Only one player can have each Helper - first to recruit them claims them permanently.

sections.title: ⚡ Special Spaces
sections.content: 🐺 Wolves Attack: Roll die, lose that many livestock and SP | ⚔️ Bandits Attack: Roll die, lose that many coins and SP | 👼 Angel Cards: Beneficial effects and blessings | 👹 Demon Cards: Challenges and setbacks

sections.title: 🏆 Winning
sections.content: First player to accumulate 40 Sacrifice Points wins the game! Plan your journey wisely and may the Lord bless your pilgrimage!

wolves.name: Wolves Attack
wolves.description: Wild wolves threaten your livestock and provisions

bandits.name: Bandits Attack
bandits.description: Highway robbers target your coins and supplies

game.title: VOYAGER
game.subtitle: Journey to Jerusalem
game.description: First to 40 Sacrifice Points wins! Answer biblical trivia, redeem for offerings, but beware of bandits and wolves!

wolves.description: Wolves attack your livestock and sacrifice points

bandits.description: Bandits attack your coins and sacrifice points

boardPositions.name: Your Village
boardPositions.description: Starting space - collect 5 SP when passing

boardPositions.name: 🐺 WOLVES ATTACK
boardPositions.description: Wild wolves threaten your livestock and provisions! Roll dice for damage.

attackConfig.modalDescription: Wild wolves emerge from the wilderness, threatening your livestock and supplies!

boardPositions.name: 👼 ANGEL CARD
boardPositions.description: Draw an angel card for divine blessings

boardPositions.name: ⚔️ BANDITS ATTACK
boardPositions.description: Highway bandits target your coins and supplies! Roll dice for damage.

attackConfig.modalDescription: Highway bandits block your path, demanding your coins and provisions!

boardPositions.name: 👹 DEMON CARD
boardPositions.description: Draw a demon card for spiritual challenges

Abraham.q: How old was Abraham when he departed from Haran to go to the land of Canaan?
What did the LORD promise Abraham when he called him to leave Haran?
Abraham.a: To make of him a great nation, bless him, make his name great, and bless all families of the earth through him (Genesis 12:1-3)

Abraham.q: Who died in Haran before Abraham departed for Canaan?
What was Abraham's name before God changed it?
From which city did Terah take his family before settling in Haran?

Sarah.q: What was Sarah's name before God changed it?
How old was Sarah when she bore Isaac, long after leaving Haran?
What relationship did Sarah have to Abraham besides being his wife?
Sarah.a: She was his sister (his father's daughter but not his mother's daughter) (Genesis 20:12)

Sarah.q: What did Sarah do when she heard the promise of a son would be fulfilled?
How did Abraham describe Sarah to Abimelech regarding their relationship?

Jacob.q: Why did Jacob flee to Haran from his father's house?
Jacob.a: Because Esau hated him and planned to kill him after Jacob stole the blessing (Genesis 27:41-43)

Jacob.q: Who was Jacob seeking to find when he arrived in Haran?
How many years did Jacob serve Laban in Haran?
Which two sisters did Jacob marry while in Haran?
How many children were born to Jacob while he was in Haran?

Abraham.q: To what land did God tell Abraham to take Isaac?
On which mountain did Abraham offer Isaac?
Abraham.a: Upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of (Genesis 22:2)

Abraham.q: What did Abraham call the place where he offered Isaac?
Abraham.a: Jehovah-jireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen (Genesis 22:14)

David.q: What did David capture to make it his capital?
David.a: The strong hold of Zion: the same is the city of David (2 Samuel 5:7)

David.q: What did David call Jerusalem after he captured it?
Where did David bring the ark of the covenant?
David.a: So David brought up the ark of the LORD unto the city of David with gladness (2 Samuel 6:12)

Solomon.q: Where did Solomon build the temple?
Solomon.a: In mount Moriah, where the LORD appeared unto David his father (1 Kings 6:1)

Solomon.q: How long did it take Solomon to build the temple?
What did Solomon place in the Most Holy Place?
Solomon.a: The priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the LORD unto his place (1 Kings 8:6)

angelCards.title: Abraham's Visitors
angelCards.effect: Gain 3 SP immediately and choose any character to gain 1 point with. Divine visitors bring blessing and revelation.
